node.display_long_description:
It's Pride Month—a time to honor the legacy of the LGBTQIA+ community, celebrate their cultural contributions, and reflect on their continued struggle for equity and social justice.

Oculus TV is a VR home for the best in immersive entertainment where you’re always at the center of the action. Get access to award-winning interactive stories, as well as immersive TV, animation and photos. Our regularly-updated lineup includes a variety of genres including sci-fi, travel, sports and more.

nodes.title: New! Rebels: A Quill Animated Story
nodes.body_text:
An Official Selection at the 2021 Tribeca Film Festival’s Immersive program.

In a parallel world where animals live as humans, an authoritarian law places a city in a state of chaos. The ‘Darwin Code’ mandates conformity to species-specific by-laws where individual expression is prohibited and heavily enforced by militarized droids who punish any that challenge the code.  But a subversive group resists and lights a flame for others to follow.  This group is known only as the ‘Rebels’.

nodes.title: Celebrate Pride Month with Parade Animation
nodes.body_text:
Parade Animation is a VR animation studio focused on technological and creative innovation and is highly committed to LGBTQ+ representation. Just like Pride parades are a platform to convey messages of LGBTQ+ rights for equality, Parade Animation strives to create more authentically represented LGBTQ+ characters in animation. Parade was founded by Yonatan Tal, a critically acclaimed gay Writer and Director. Yonatan graduated from the Character Animation Program at CalArts and worked at the Development department of Disney TV.

‘Lifetime Achievement’ is Parade’s first VR experience, a story that follows world-class French designer, Albert, on a journey to create a masterpiece for his mother. Join him on his adventure to encounter an African albino crocodile, develop new lifeforms in a lab, and capture light rays from a spatial solar eclipse. His elaborate expedition taught him the valuable lesson that presence is the best present.

node.reviewDescription:
This is a very basic very player with limited functionality.  It does an adequate job of playing content but has ZERO adjustment features to color, brightness, tilt/orientation of viewer.

Worst of all Oculus TV has either extremely dated or not-even-VR recommendations.  It’s 2021 and right on my home screen near the top
OTV is like “watch this video from 2016”.  As of this writing they’re hyping some Oscar short film for like a month.  I finally check it out .... its a 2D film!

Really odd that Facebook of all companies couldn’t manage this aspect better.
